title: E field - field at a point in line with 2 charge

content.question: Two small, positively charged spheres are located on the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>-axis, as shown in the figure. What is the magnitude of the electric field at <math alttext="x equals x sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator 4 times pi epsilon sub 0, end fraction, times, the fraction with numerator q sub 1 plus q sub 2, and denominator x sub 3, end sub, squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi><msub><mi>ε</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>q</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>q</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mrow><msubsup><mi>x</mi><mn>3</mn><mn>2</mn></msubsup></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator 4 times pi epsilon sub 0, end fraction, times, the fraction with numerator q sub 1 plus q sub 2, and denominator, open parenthesis, x sub 2 minus x sub 1, close parenthesis, squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi><msub><mi>ε</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>q</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>q</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator 4 times pi epsilon sub 0, end fraction, times, open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator q sub 1, and denominator x sub 1, end sub, squared, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator q sub 2, and denominator x sub 2, end sub, squared, end fraction, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi><msub><mi>ε</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><msub><mi>q</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><msup><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><msub><mi>q</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msubsup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn><mn>2</mn></msubsup></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator 4 times pi epsilon sub 0, end fraction, times, open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator q sub 1, and denominator, open parenthesis, x sub 3 minus x sub 1, close parenthesis, squared, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator q sub 2, and denominator, open parenthesis, x sub 3 minus x sub 2, close parenthesis, squared, end fraction, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi><msub><mi>ε</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><msub><mi>q</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><msub><mi>q</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator 4 times pi epsilon sub 0, end fraction, times, open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator q sub 1, and denominator, open parenthesis, x sub 3 minus x sub 1, close parenthesis, squared, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator q sub 2, and denominator, open parenthesis, x sub 3 minus x sub 2, close parenthesis, squared, end fraction, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi><msub><mi>ε</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><msub><mi>q</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><msub><mi>q</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 8: Electric Charges, Fields, and Gauss's Law

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
